greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Sum_{n>=1} |phi - c(n)|, where phi is the golden ratio (A001622) and c(n) are the convergents to phi.
comment: Define the deviance of x > 0 by dev(x) = Sum_{n>=1} |x - c(n,x)|, where c(n,x) = n-th convergent to x. The greatest value of dev(x) occurs when x = golden ratio, so that this constant is the maximal deviance.
formula: Equals Sum_{n>=1} 1/(F(2*n-1)*F(2*n)), where F(n) is the n-th Fibonacci number (A000045).
mathematica: x = GoldenRatio; z = 600; c = Convergents[x, z];
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Dec 06 2015
